reviews.review_msg: Friendly and looks very smart, explain stuff well and at the end he asks you to explain it back to him.  ask him whats on the exam and he ll give you some helpful hints
Avoid this Guy. he told me Ill be fine and I got F

312 is a killer course but he tries to make it easier. Fashionable guy, doenst answer emails. ended up with B+. dont take it summer time as the course is very demanding. Ace the first midterm , final will screw you.
Nice Guy, Knows his stuff, smart, provide his phone number to students but never picks up the phone!

Absolutely awful teacher. Bahram did not answer emails and when I went to his office hours once and did not show up. He also canceled his only office hours a day before the final. The Course was entirely run by TAs and the prof only did an hour of reading slides out loud and prepared tests unrelated to assignments. one of the worst profs at sfu

Bahram is a super nice guy but has 0 teaching ability. During the online semester, he just pre-recorded videos of himself reading Pearson slide decks word for word and did nothing else. Exams featured questions never seen before on homework/textbook. Stopped providing practice questions after the first exam. Class was an absolute waste of money.

The prof read off the slide and did a few easy example questions that were already given to you on Canvas. We had quizzes every week that also came straight from same answer key we already had. Gave little information about midterm and final and the difficulty level was way harder than practice questions from each chapter.

I understand that this is his first time teaching, butttt, wth is that. Who teaches like that, he would constantly make mistakes in calculations. He went over 4 chapters on the second lecture. Super dry, but was accommodating. I truly belive that he should read the slides before explaining them to us, and I thing that SFU sucks at picking profs.

Altug is a solid prof and is passionate about finance as a subject. He will make sure to help his students achieve academic success, all you have to do is take the time out and ask and attend his office hours. He prefers to solve questions by hand in class which is very helpful in preparing for exams. His grading was clear as well.

This was Altug's first time teaching and I thought he did a pretty decent job. He was very flexible and accommodating to his students requests and ensured that our learning was his focus. The lectures were really dry as he just read right off of them. Basically, you got to learn the content on your own, but his assignments weren't overly difficult.

You're in good hands with Jose. He excels at "improv" (answering questions, spontaneous examples, etc). When he reads off the slides it can be boring, but he tries engaging the class. If it's not clear the first time, ask him, he does a good job clarifying. I read the textbook but slides were sufficient. Know the formulas and do his practice sets!!
Really easy going guy. Get yourself prepared by doing all the problem set+reading the slides will just bring you above the average! Real gem
